ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.
M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: You have decided to answer these questions because you have experience hearing voices. Is this correct?
Have you received mental health services to treat your voices?
How often do you hear voices?
Notes: 1=I hear voices at least once a week; 2=I hear voices at least once a day; 3=I hear voices at least once an hour; 4=I hear voices continuously or almost continuously

ElementDescription: Tx: Group home and/or residential services
Tx: One-on-one care with mental health professional (psychologist, social worker, counselor, psychiatrist)
Who Knows of Voices: No one knows
Who Knows of Voices: Significant other (i.e. boyfriend, girlfriend, spouse)
Who Knows of Voices: Immediate Family
Who Knows of Voices: Extended Family
Who Knows of Voices: Some of my friends
Who Knows of Voices: All of my friends
Who Knows of Voices: Medical professionals / Primary doctor / Therapist
Who Knows of Voices: People you know online but not in person
